website_summaries.verdict: Not the best choice for espresso (low pressure), but ideal for one or two cups of gourmet coffee, even cold brew. Easy to assemble and clean between uses.
pros: Can produce coffee in as little as 30 seconds
Works well with cooler water temperatures
cons: Produces a limited amount of coffee (10 to 12 ounces) at a time
Some coffee grounds can leak into brew
Plastic construction prone to cracking and discoloration

customer_reviews.title: Easily my favorite coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second one of these because I couldn't stand the coffee at work but didn't want to be without one for home. I'm a former barista (current coffee snob) and can tell you that this can favorably go up against a $300 machine. Make sure to wet the gasket before you move it through the outer tube. I wasn't doing that at first and started seeing wear quickly. Ever since I started getting the seal wet, I haven't seen any further degradation at all.
customer_reviews.author: A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: I love this little coffee plunger of awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: The Aeropress coffee maker defies logic. It looks like it belongs more in a mad scientist's lab than an everyday kitchen. But don't be scared of it's gnarly design, it produces one mean and delightful cup of coffee. It's unique, vacuum plunging style of coffee brewing lends itself to making a cup of joe that's bitter-free, and exploding with robust flavors that will tackle the heart strings of even the toughest of java critics among us. Oh, and it just so happens to be the perfect on the go coffee maker for any and all of my fuyure camping adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B. Bugay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is only my third morning of using my new AeroPress, but WOW am I impressed. Using the same bean and grind as before (with my Bodum French Press), my coffee tastes SO much better. Gone is the acidity and bitterness. I couldn't believe how much I enjoyed the my first cup of coffee brewed with this thing. I'm still sorting through the various methods of brewing with it, but so far Stumptown's YouTube method is my favorite - simple, and with great results.
customer_reviews.author: Louroy

customer_reviews.title: Complicated
customer_reviews.text: "Some assembly required" would be an understatement. If you want to spend the time to insert, screw, add, etc. the various pieces, grounds, and water, to obtain a cup or three of coffee, in exactly the correct temperature(s) and proportions, be my guest. I found the coffee too strong and bitter. I believe the attached instructions speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: trackhorse

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but easy to mess up
customer_reviews.text: I give this four stars, but have experienced the following annoyances. You will too, but will likely forgive your little AeroPress. 1. Forgetting the filter 2. Misaligning the filter 3. Accidentally adding two filters 4. Toppling the mug by pressing too hard 5. Forgetting the screen altogether and spilling coffee everywhere 6. Dripping coffee on the counter and trash bin 7. Fighting to unscrew the tight filter after use 8. Squirting coffee over the edge of the mug while pressing hard But still, we like this coffee press. It seems like the simplest one available.
customer_reviews.author: Ray White

customer_reviews.title: Fast, single serving coffee.  Great for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a decent single-serving cup of coffee faster than anything other than Keurig. Faster than french-press, way faster than drip. As close as I've come to espresso without using an actual espresso machine (but not the same as espresso either). Very forgiving regarding grind density, can be used with just about any grind of coffee. Plastic design is durable and light, good for travel. Has several pieces, easy to loose the filter cap if you don't keep it screwed on when not in use. Also very effective at making strong medicinal herbal teas. Echinacea, Pau d' Arco, Ginger, etc. You can steep the tea and then put in through the press to make a concentrated extract.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for this Desk Jockey
customer_reviews.text: I use the AeroPress daily to make coffee in the office. Rather than drinking the Folgers pumped out of our communal coffee maker, I can brew any coffee of my choosing without disturbing anyone else or worrying about other people drinking all the coffee. This has become an essential piece of office equipment especially since my wife and I had our first child. Without my afternoon cup, I’d crash and burn. And spreadsheets don’t create themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Trav

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer's Packaging Weak
customer_reviews.text: Liked one I bought for myself so 2 stars instead of 1. Bought another in late October (I shop early) for a Christmas present. When opened it was broken. Not because of the Amazon packaging which was quite good, but because the manufacturer's packaging is quite cheap. Plastic on main tube broken around the skirt. Broken pieces still in package. Not usable. Since I bought early, I'm out $36 which kind of sours me on the product. They could do a lot better than the flimsy container they insist on on a breakable item.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee. Easy to clean. Great build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great single cup of coffee. Throw away the instructions this comes with, because those brewing directions are garbage... just watch some YouTube videos on how to brew a good cup. It’s super easy to clean as well. If you’re one who likes to only make a single cup at a time, but finds that those pod based machines like a Keurig are not cutting it for you (usually too weak if you’re using a refillable k-cup), this is for you. And you can easily travel with this. It just seems like the coffee tastes better with this than with a standard drip-pot method, and it’s significantly better than a pod based system.
customer_reviews.author: nolamjc

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 28 days and already lost suction - cheap piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth your time. I have followed the instructions for use and care (hand washing immediately after use, letting it air dry, storing the parts separately), and it has already lost it's suction. It was making great coffee up to a week ago and now it's too late for me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: mountaingecko

customer_reviews.title: Must have for coffee drinkers, but new ones aren't as good as the old one quality wise
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 AeroPresses now. They are great and a certain necessity for coffee drinkers. But the latest one I have doesn't have a great seal on it. I had exchanged it for another and this one, too, has the same issue with the the plunger just not being a precise fit. Problem is that when pressing it causes the plunger to "slip" either releasing air and causing an unstable shift while pressing (with 200 degree water) or at the least causes an inconsistency in the plunge. Hopefully others have had this issue and the defect will be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: A.Texas.Yankee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good quality materials, easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Great for making a single cup of strong coffee at my desk. Lets me use whatever coffee I want rather than the cheap stale junk at work. No expensive ridiculous proprietary parts, no expensive disposables, just cheap paper filters. Easy to use at the desk without making a mess thanks to the included funnel. Easy and quick to clean too, just a quick rinse. Used it a few dozen times now, no issues so far, no warping from the high temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Changed the way I enjoy coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I never realized how perfect coffee could be until I used an Aeropress! I have used pre-ground coffee with a regular drip machine, keurigs (with k-cups and reusable), and numerous coffee shop coffees and while I have always loved coffee, I always felt like something was missing. What was missing was the tools to make a perfect cup of coffee. This is a must-have if you love coffee! It's so easy to use, easy to clean, and fast to make a cup of coffee! I purchased this, a Shanik burr grinder, and Death Wish coffee and I made the best coffee I have EVER had! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I researched what the internet had to say about the best coffee maker you can buy, and AeroPress was the winner. I, however, find it clumsy and clunky to use, and if you do not have a bit of arm strength you will have issues pushing the plunger smoothly. Despite the instructions, I could not get the hang of making more than one cup of coffee at a time, and it really is an espresso/Americano maker. It is now in the back of the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome for traveling. It's lightweight, packs easily, makes incredibly good coffee, and is relatively easy to clean up. No more nasty hotel room coffee for me! The coffee it makes is so good I've started using it at home as well. We're also planning on taking it on some camping trips this summer. I'm not sure whether it's compact or lightweight enough for backpacking, but we may try that as well.
customer_reviews.author: P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: After trying different high end coffee makers and paid $$$$ for them I found out about this product and decided to give it a try... Not sure why but the coffee taste much better than any other coffee makers I have tried. I only use this one when making one or two coffee cups. For more than 2-3 cups I will use the other coffee makers since it is quicker. I highly recommend this one for 1-2 cups and you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Script

customer_reviews.title: Gateway to tasty coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is not an espresso maker (not enough pressure) but a great coffee immersion brewing method. It only takes about 2 minutes to brew 1 cup of coffee (10 oz). You won't get a lot of coffee out of this (major con), but it will be a great tasting cup. There are also hundreds of recipes available online to try. It's also fun to use, easy to clean, extremely portable, and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Drakkar

customer_reviews.title: FAILed after just four months
customer_reviews.text: This guage was working great for three months or so, when I went to check on things at four months, the guage was not working! It was all the way to the max pressure, and would not change. so sad. (I'm trying to figure out a way to get a message to the seller now) ~ Vicki
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great coffee strength & flavor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a stranger and could not be happier with. My french presses have sat on the counter with only being used a couple of times since the AeroPress arrived. I wish there were better options for storage/holders here on Amazon as the third party holders don't look that great to me, but that has nothing to do with the actual functionality and performance of the wonderfully compact and easy to use AeroPress. Be sure to read about inverse brewing method...it is all I do now with my AeroPress.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Darn good coffee. Easy to make.  Wish Quisp Cereal was still being made.
customer_reviews.text: Yep. The reviews are right. Darn good coffee. Easy to make. Easy to clean. Wish they made a glass beaker instead of plastic, but water is so briefly in contact that it probably doesn't matter. Now, if I could only find a vintage box of Quisp cereal to enjoy my life would be complete. I think the Quisp Cereal Martian dude had an aero beanie or something on his head -- which maybe was subliminal reason I chose to follow my heart and purchase this AeroPress. Regardless, I like this item. It's fast, solid, and makes the best cup of coffee I have ever had -- and that's saying something. Quisp, I shall continue my quest to find you.
customer_reviews.author: ggodzilla

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd AeroPress. I bought the first one years ago - oh, it's still going strong, I simply tired of packing it to visit family so Ieft it at my parents and bought another for home. This allows me to create the cleanest, most balanced cup of coffee I've ever had, and it has ruined all other coffee makers for me. I still have an old Keurig, but it's now been relegated to heating up water. For my AeroPress.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: While my husband still thinks our home coffee espresso maker makes superior tasting coffee, I think it makes a good cup. Light years better than the drip pot at my MIL home. I bought a manual grinder to use with it but it's too much pia to grind it for that long by hand. I will, however, use the Aeropress. Seems decent quality. I do upside down method which I think will help prevent leaking or wear out the seal. I will likely get a battery/rechargeable grinder for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jopalis

customer_reviews.title: Worth a Try
customer_reviews.text: I love coffee so I have to try just about every coffee product that's available. Hence, this purchase. It makes a very good cup of coffee, but I'm not convinced that it's worth the price. I'll keep it and continue to use it, but I would have enjoyed coffee just as much without it. If you're curious as I was, it's worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Mis

customer_reviews.title: The AeroPress - a holy gift from the coffee Gods.
customer_reviews.text: I never knew coffee could taste so good. Grind beans to fine/medium-fine Set-up aeropress Put ground beans in filter start timer pour hot water over beans in aeropress stir for 10 seconds insert aeropress plunger to close the aeropress, but don't push. after 1m15s stir again then slowly press when it makes the suction sound your done from the time you start your timer until you're done, 1:45-1:55.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: and the Aeropress is a great substitute. I can quickly brew a single cup ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s finally time to dump my Keurig, and the Aeropress is a great substitute. I can quickly brew a single cup of coffee with any fresh ground beans I like, and the flavor is infinitely better than anything from a K-cup. Plus, it produces less waste. I’ve had so much fun trying coffees from my local roasters and tinkering with the brew parameters (temperature, time, agitation) to get it just right. This simple little device is really all you need to make a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: I like pandas

customer_reviews.title: Like coffee from a coffee shop.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the hardest time finding a way to make coffee that tastes like the coffee I get from my favorite local coffee shop....UNTIL THIS! It’s SO easy and QUICK to use. And the coffee...it’s incredible!! I highly recommend. I don’t even have a fancy kettle- just like a basic electric kettle to heat the water.
customer_reviews.author: Annalyssa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Will never go back! Was very skeptical at first. Heard good things about the AeroPress, but was personally difficult to believe coffee could taste better using this contraption, as opposed to the French Press. Another fad? Well, I'm hooked! This puppy goes with me everywhere! So easy to travel with. If you're an avid coffee drinker, you will love it too!
customer_reviews.author: J Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I recently went to a coffee shop that used an AeroPress and was offered one. After having a couple cups from one I was hooked. This thing makes an amazing tasting cup of coffee and it's much easier to use than it looks. Once you get your routine down its a cinch. I've tried other methods of brewing and this one wins every time. I also travel a lot and it's super convenient to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Catara Carrell

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with the Aero
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite coffee brewer. Simple, fast, efficient, inexpensive, as well as bullet proof reliable. My $2000 rosito bisani espresso machine has nothing on this little simple design. It makes the very best cup of coffee I've ever had, and I used to own a coffee shop, and had expensive equipment. You can make authentic espresso without a fancy machine! Simply amazing. It's also super easy to clean. Takes about 5 seconds no joke!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... two other adults so a one cup maker is perfect. I have been drinking very good instant for ...
customer_reviews.text: I am the only coffee drinker in my a house of two other adults so a one cup maker is perfect. I have been drinking very good instant for years which is costly and discovered a whole bean coffee I like and was looking for a way to make it. My son introduced me to the Aerobie on my last trip to California so seemed like a great fit. I love the convenience of having a fresh brew with out waste. Am loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Short

customer_reviews.title: A rare detractor
customer_reviews.text: I know this thing seems to be the most beloved brewing device known to coffee enthusiasts, but I just do not enjoy the act of using it. Compared to a pourover, there are way more parts and cleaning is much more complicated. I also think the pourover tastes better. I also just feel vaguely uncomfortable putting boiling water under pressure, I know this is illogical because it's not gonna break but nevertheless it affects my enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Adam E. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Hard to make bad coffee
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for almost a year now, and it still makes great coffee. I haven't had issues with the plunger degrading yet, and I use the inverted brewing method so I would know if that had happened. Super easy to clean, I usually push the plunger with it aimed in the trash, and all the grounds fall right off with the filter. Then just a quick little rinse and I'm done It's hard to make bad coffee with this thing. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Takes some effort and two minutes but well well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade from a 3rd party Keurig compatible pod coffeemaker due to the very high reviews and honestly this is something I should have done many years ago. It will take a few tries and you will need to use a drip or finer ground coffee but seriously -- I never knew coffee could taste this good just like a cafe or going to starbucks. It is really that hard to tell. The coffeecomes out dark, bold, bright and clean. Just be prepared to experiment. This a solid winner and I will not be going back to a regular drip machine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chang

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I'm delighted with the AeroPress. It makes very good coffee. I've had it for about a year, and I still use it, which should say something. Please note that I am not a coffee snob. I generally use Folgers in the AeroPress. My brother is much more... discerning... about his coffee, and he has three AeroPresses, so I guess he likes it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sruli

customer_reviews.title: Get the one with the bag included
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag, this one doesnt come with it. Also get the fellow espresso accessory, it's great. Get a hand grinder, the long skinny one will slide into the aeropress and do your coffee right. Otherwise, what more to say about my go to way for coffee brewing. Genius invention.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raitses

customer_reviews.title: Give your Keurig to the uncultured troglodytes!
customer_reviews.text: Are you looking for a great single-cup coffee maker? Your search is over! This little guy makes coffee that is comparable to my Chemex, but takes less time. Fast, tasty, and easy to clean! You can use paper filters or buy a metal filter (not included), play with the potency, it’s really quite nice. Stop using all that plastic for K-Cups, and getting gross burnt coffee from that oversized monstrosity! It’s worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Simpson

customer_reviews.title: a great product. much better than a french press
customer_reviews.text: a great product. much better than a french press, at least for me. compact, easy to use, lots of variables to control to find the right cup for you (water temp, amount, coffee grind, coffee amount, steep time, etc. also, cleans up VERY quickly and easily. and small enough to travel with you. the best recipe i found was the "inverted force multiplier" on youtube. i think if you google that phrase on youtube.com you'll get the quick video and all you need to make a great cup of coffee. i tried paper and metal filters, and never noticed any difference between the two.
customer_reviews.author: N. Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Was deciding between this and a Chemex. Although I love pour over coffee, the aero press is hard to beat. It's ugly but it is a work horse. I would not recommend it if you're making coffee for multiple people every morning. Also doesn't make true espresso. But the aroma and coffee it makes from my Ethiopian beans is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Aeromess
customer_reviews.text: The coffee tasted good however this thing is hard to use. You have to be pretty strong to push the plunger down as air gets trapped and it takes some exertion. Clean up is easy so five star on that but when I am plunging down it gets coffee all over. Sorry sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Result Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Good espresso. But it is too hyped for what it provides which is a mediocre cup of coffee . I actually went back to my Melitta one-step cone and was amused that it tasted better than Aero . Plus the clean-up --. Aero can be messy. Paper towels are essential. And all of it is made of plastic. Nice packaging, though. And coffee without bitterness? Really? Also if you have arthritis in your hands and a bad back, be careful! Not nearly as cool or as efficient as it says. And not so economical either.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Ohanesian

customer_reviews.title: especially if you like concentrated coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is the same company that makes the Aerobie flying ring that can basically fly a mile, thrown. How they took that technology to a coffee press, I don't know, but this works very well. Does NOT make a large batch, especially if you like concentrated coffee, but enough for 1 cup. Unlike their flying disc, I am willing to say that this cannot be thrown very far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This works just as advertised. 10/10 no ragrets, not even a single letter.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Great Cup of Joe!
customer_reviews.text: I use to use a French press to make my coffee and then got this aeropress to bring with on travel. I liked it so much that now I use the aeropress while at home. So easy to clean and much quicker to make a delicious coffee than a French press. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee and very good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm an admitted coffee snob and use a Chemex system in my office. However, a colleague suggested I try this and, because of the low price, I did. Not quite to my Chemex standard but darn close. Very good cup of coffee and extremely easy to use and clean. Taking this with me as my travel coffee maker on business trips.
customer_reviews.author: PAHunter

customer_reviews.title: It makes excellent coffee that can almost be substituted for espresso
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before but lost in in a divorce. I got this one to have on hand for power outages and camping. It makes excellent coffee that can almost be substituted for espresso. You can grind your coffee finer than drip but don't grind to super extra fine though or it will clog the filter and you won't be able to press the coffee through.
customer_reviews.author: M. Freed

customer_reviews.title: Use AeroPress.  Get rid of your drip coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker ever. Don't use boiling water, but water at 180-185 degrees. Makes all the difference. Never any bitterness. Use cappuccino setting on my burr grinder for whole bean purchases. Works well with pre-ground coffee too. Makes cheap grinds taste good. I can make enough for a crowd by making two batches of four cups each and serving it from my glass lined carafe. Won't go back to k cups or drip machine. Travels well for best coffee away from home too.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, one issue
customer_reviews.text: So this little thing makes the best coffee I've tasted since my trip to Italy. I love the fact that I can make an espresso shot (which I sometimes pour over gelato for a great-tasting affogato) and I can also make my regular-size coffee. I wish it had come with a mug, but luckily I have a "sturdy" one of my own. My only objection is that, while it says that "gentle pressure is the key," the plunger is extremely hard to push down. There's no way it will budge with gentle pressure, I have to lean hard on it and fear that the mug may slip out from under, sending hot coffee flying everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jass

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: It's very good. I like the inverted method to make my coffee. The coffee tastes better than french press. You can't make as much coffee as a french press but it's a perfect size for me. Hopefully it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nam Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! The lower water temperature combined with the shorter ...
customer_reviews.text: You've got to be kidding me! This thing is awesome! The lower water temperature combined with the shorter brew time compared to most other coffee making methods result in an unusually smooth cup of joe. Tastes kind of like cold brew. The only downside is that you can only make a single cup at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cheung

customer_reviews.title: makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: just after making just a few cups of coffee I had using this dialed in to make some very delicious cups of coffee and the whole house is wanting me to make them a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: paul lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must buy!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our AeroPress! We have many means to make coffee in our house... Coffee maker, kuerig, French press, pour over, cold brew, percolator... but this is he single best way to get STRONG coffee! Only way we really make coffee anymore! Can’t rave about it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Keirsten

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Use, Simple to Clean and Excellent Tasting Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and consistency. High quality parts that I see lasting for years. The product is extremely simple to use with less time commitment and very little cleanup compared to a drip machine or a traditional coffee press. I would highly recommend getting an electric kettle with a temperature gauge so you can easily heat water to 175 degrees. It does make a difference. The accessories are helpful, and having the endless supply of filters is great - I won't be looking for anything but new coffees to try for the next year (at least).
customer_reviews.author: ShellyMoonfly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and so affordable
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly cool thing to have. Great way to quickly make some strong iced espresso before work. It takes awhile to figure out how much coffee beans and water to your liking, I just microwave a cup of water and put it through twice to make a strong beverage. Highly recommend, espresso tastes great when you get it right.
customer_reviews.author: parksshopping

customer_reviews.title: A handy gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use device for making quick, individual sized cups of coffee. I love that it's so easy to dispose of the coffee grounds (unlike a french press). It's small enough that it is really easy to travel with. Great for both the office or camping--really anywhere so long as you have access to boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, amazing coffee
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that was quick and easy but still provided a good cup of coffee. This aeropress is PERFECT!! It’s the best cup of coffee that I ever had, and it really couldn’t be easier. I don’t take advantage of the portability, but I know some who do. I just keep it at home, and I absolutely love my purchase. So worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T

customer_reviews.title: I was searching for the perfect single coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for the perfect single coffee maker. I am the only coffee drinker in my house. I have used a French press, Keurig, Brun one cup and also a traditional 10 cup maker. My neighbor told me about the AeroPress. I was skeptical since its plastic and has a strange design. I have to say my coffee is so amazing every morning now by using the AeroPress!! I no longer use creamer! Just straight black coffee never tasted so good! I am so happy I decided to try it. The best part? It's so easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Brownie1014

customer_reviews.title: An amazing luxury for a truck driver.
customer_reviews.text: I'm immensely glad I bought this. I'm a truck driver so a sink is a luxury I don't always have access to. Clean up is quick and painless. Just twist off the filter cap, pop the grounds into a trash bag, then wipe the end of the plunger with a damp napkin. Design from a brewing perspective is also great. Being able to apply pressure to the filter allows for the use of a much finer grind than a pour over brewer, increasing the percentage of extracted solids. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good gift for coffee enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun coffee gadget. I worried that some parts would break during shipping because it’s plastic, but everything was intact. Compared to a french press, the coffee tastes less acidic. Starbucks imo usually tastes like burnt coffee, but through the aeropress, I think the burnt flavor mellowed out.
customer_reviews.author: Cladnoir

customer_reviews.title: Saving money now making coffee this way and it tastes so much better than what I get at the coffee shop near ...
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these for the house/camping trips. I bought this one for work!! Saving money now making coffee this way and it tastes so much better than what I get at the coffee shop near work! I LOVE AeroPress!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Powers

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: This gets 5 stars. Why: 1) Really inexpensive 2) Makes great coffee 3) Easy to clean 4) Fast. I have A LOT of coffee gear. A burr grinder, Chemex, french press, mocha pot, hario pour over, and now aeropress. I like the aeropress, because it is delicious and easy to make a small amount. and it is as easy to clean as chemex and hario. I use an infrared thermometer to check that my water is not too hot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Erlich

customer_reviews.title: This is an effective way to make coffee.
customer_reviews.text: This was my third purchase of getting this product. It may take a few tries to get the hang of it but it was well worth it. It makes amazing coffee. I grind my own beans and the end result is amazing coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for coffee at work!
customer_reviews.text: This has transformed my coffee drinking experience! I used to use a Keurig, then switched to a Ninja at home. But I was still using Keurig pods at work until a co worker told me about the Aeropress. It’s super easy to make a good coffee without access to a full kitchen for cleaning up. AAnd the coffee is so good, I’ve even purchased another one for home :)
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Hafer

customer_reviews.title: Surprise yourself by making a better cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very well made! I was impressed that it did all that it advertised to do: made a very good cup of coffee. Better than my chemx. It is not as easy as drip coffee because you have to operate the plunger and store the parts - but the effort is worth it if you want to enjoy the best cup of coffee you can make at home (or on the road). I use it with the Bonavita variable temperature gooseneck kettle so I can brew my coffee at 81 degrees centigrade as AeroPress recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shiflett

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: The AeroPress makes a great cup of coffee within two minutes. I found that a stainless steel filter allows more flavor to pour through the Aeropress than the paper filter does yet doesn't allow for the fines to leave a residue that a french press leaves behind.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college students! Low waste, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I think that all college students who live in a dorm should buy one of these instead of a french press or keurig! You can make a mean cup of coffee in literally 2 mins. It is also very very easy to clean (you just plunger the grounds out) which I love because it was so difficult to clean my french press. The coffee comes out smooth, grounds have never made it in my cup. If you or someone you know who loves coffee is heading off to college, you gotta get em this
customer_reviews.author: Daniele

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Compact and makes great coffee. It takes some getting used to. Look to youtube for different techniques. I think I am going to love this long term!
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Hibbs

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup of coffee, with big caveats
customer_reviews.text: This really is an unfinished product for the most part it kinda works, and it might be a little better than a french press. Two major faults: 1. It takes 2 fills to make a decent sized cup of joe in the morning. Way too much work. 2. The filter doesn't line up properly, and if you grind it down nicely itll go right through the sides (the filter doesn't even touch that part). I think perhaps 2 cups out of 10 I might get without grounds. They need to change the filter mechanics -- it doesn't work. This product is half baked.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Siggins

customer_reviews.title: Split decision
customer_reviews.text: Okay, the product makes the coffee taste great, but it is messy. Sometimes the filter lets the coffee grounds through and my cup of java is ruined or I have to re filter it with another/different application. The filter press does not hold enough water and I have to withdraw the plunger and add more water which means sometimes the grounds come up with it and go all over my and counter and sink. Coffee does taste better with this press but since it is so messy and often lets espresso grounds sift through the filter I have to give it only two stars, sorry I was hoping for more too.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH CAMPBELL

customer_reviews.title: Hubby's Go-To Over the Keurig!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our Keurig is hit or miss. We received it as a gift and it started acting goofy so mother-in-law gifted us with another. Yay! Totally not ungrateful, I swear, but when we want coffee, we want a brewer that is consistent. Hubby researched the AeroPress while we were in Keurig hell and decided he wanted one particularly to take on deployments with him (he's in the Navy). It hasn't made onto the boat yet as it is used everyday in our house! It makes a very smooth espresso/coffee and it doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: KS80

customer_reviews.title: I've told so many people how great and easy this is to use
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I've told so many people how great and easy this is to use, they swear I'm getting paid, lol. If you love the taste of great coffee and enjoy hand grinding freshly roasted beans, then this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Heath13

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Aeropress for a few months now it is awesome. I don't get to use it much cause I have a manual grinder and it takes me like 15 mins to grind the beans lol but when I do use the Aeropress it is always an amazing cup of coffee. I would definelty recomment watching videos on YouTube and trying a few different recipes!! Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Albert d.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great cup of coffee and quickly. My son owns a coffee house and he suggested I buy one of these because of how good a cup of coffee it makes. He wasnt wrong! Works wonderful with the Bonivita gooseneck kettle!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne M

customer_reviews.title: Hands down my favorite coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a barista by trade, and I keep raving to my friends and customers about how much I love my AeroPress. I use both the included paper filters and the reusable mesh filter you can buy separately, and when I use the paper, this thing makes the smoothest, tastiest cup of coffee I’ve ever had. Use the mesh filter and you will get something resembling French press coffee. Again, when I say smooth coffee I mean SMOOTH. I’m also going to be that snobby guy who takes this thing on vacation with him...
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: My 1000 and 1500 ml French Presses Collecting Dust
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second AeroPress so that my wife will be able to have great coffee when I am travelling. While travelling I would make 3 cups in the morning. I would drink one and pour the other 2 into a thermos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about how great this is! My cousin owns a coffee-roasting company, and she's the one who recommended it to me. This is what she uses when she's not at her shop. I use mine nearly every day--and made good use of it when I took an extended vacation. The coffee this makes is SO SMOOTH! It's easy to use, extremely easy to clean, and it takes up hardly any space. It may not be quite as convenient as a pod-type coffee maker, but it really does enable you to make THE BEST coffee/espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: So the AeroPress makes absolutely amazing coffee. With this, I've been able to make some real dark coffees without overly burnt or bitter taste. The micro filters are really great at filtering out a lot (all?) of the oils that can make coffee taste very bitter. Note that "true" coffee enthusiasts might scoff at this since the coffee isn't as "full-bodied" as it could/should be. Cleanup is relatively easy, but keep in mind it's similar to a french press or anything else in that's it's still a good amount of work for each cup of coffee. Consider sticking with a regular coffee pot if you think you might be too lazy to do this every time...
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Well priced
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my daughter who says there is a learning curve on using it to figure out the right amount of water & coffee. She’s enjoying it
customer_reviews.author: Irish3

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker I've Found
customer_reviews.text: The AeroPress produces some of the best tasting coffee I've ever had. I'm still experimenting with different methods, although this reviewer's method has so far been the best: (...) Anyway, the AeroPress produces coffee with a rich, bold flavor, but without the bitterness of other methods. It's also pretty much self cleaning! Since the rubber stopper on the plunger is sealed to the sides of the press, all the extra grounds get pushed into the "puck" of coffee grounds at the bottom. Just eject the push, give each part of the press a light rinse, and you're! Overall, best coffee maker I've used. Perfect for making coffee at work during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still an absolutely outstanding product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second arrow press. My first one survived years of camping as well as every day use. This new version has a couple of nice little upgrades from the original version. Still an absolutely outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a portable coffee maker for work. This is exactly what I needed. It's compact, durable, and makes a great cup of coffee. The rubber on the press has a little wear, but it hasn't affected it's coffee making abilities in the 2.5 months i've had it.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean and produces a great cup of coffee. No fussing around with equipment! Just heat up some water, snap it together (very easily I might add) and pour a steaming cup. Rinse it out and you're done. Who needs electricity? And mess? Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Um yEAH!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used an Italian Press for years but the aluminum shell and through a friend suggesting the affects of that with coffee I moved to this. Holy Smokes, had some fresh beans blended and made my first cup it was so stinking smooth! Never going back to the Italian this is the way to get a good smooth coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Still completely impressed with this simple way to make a great cup of coffee/espresso
customer_reviews.text: The new plastic is slicker then the older plastic and has a different, cheaper feel to it (I have an original). I wrote to Aerobie to complain and received and immediate response. Turn out the old plastic was having some cracking issues, which I never saw, and they had to switch the plastic. The new plastic has increased lubricity and the plunger slides easier, it is more resilient to cracks and it still makes the same cup of coffee. Still completely impressed with this simple way to make a great cup of coffee/espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Paulybagodonuts

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this coffee maker at a coffee house that I was visiting. I decided to go ahead and try it and the results are a wonderful, full-bodied cup of coffee and easy to make. I have replace my usual coffee-making process with this one. Makes a cup of concentrated coffee, quite like expresso that can be diluted to make an Americano. Great fun. Great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Geary

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I'm not by any means a coffee guru, but I am picky and enjoy a high end, high quality cup of coffee when I go out. I can finally make a decent cup at home now! I measure the water temp, a must here for good results. I've owned drip, French press, percolators and pour overs. Product takes up a small amount of space, and no counter space (awesome), making great for traveling and is perfect for people and families who only make one or two cups at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the “morning” person.
customer_reviews.text: The coffe this thing produces is wonderful! My issue has nothing to do with the press. I am not coordinated enough in the morning to use such a complicating piece of heavy equipment. I’ve burnt myself on several occasions and dumped hot coffe grounds on my feet. I’ve screamed profanities at 5 am a couple of times. If I go get a cup of coffee from the gas station down the street, I’m usually awake enough to make coffee when I get home!
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Brecheisen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your daily coffee
customer_reviews.text: While it takes a certain amount of getting used to, the Aeropress is perfect for my needs of making a single serving of coffee every morning. It comes with a complete kit out of the box, and has held up to my use over the past 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik V.

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Fan
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I was a little underwhelmed by this little gadget at first. The coffee wasn't rave-worthy, and I couldn't understand what all the glowing reviews were about. But I used it again last night and must have been doing something wrong before, because the coffee came out wonderfully. Smooth, flavorful, just the right strength. I'm a fan now, that's for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Lara Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Makes great brews!
customer_reviews.text: I love brewing coffee with this gadget along with my mini porlex grinder at work. I often get requests from my coworkers to make them some as well. I highly recommend getting a metal filter and ditching all the included accessories (less to clean and store). You can either go technical with amount of coffee water and all that. Or if you are lazy like me, just toss in whatever and still get a great brew.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Allows a couple more minutes of sleep in the morning.
customer_reviews.text: My sense of taste isn't so refined that I can tell the difference between this and my old over-mug filter drip thingy. But what I can clearly detect is how much sooner my coffee is done. With the old drip filter, I'd have to keep coming back, pouring in a bit more water and waiting for it to drain before doing so again. With the AeroPress, the coffee is in my mug and ready to pour into my face in 1 minute. Cleaning takes an additional minute. For that alone, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Simple, quick, and effective
customer_reviews.text: Makes a quick great cup. It's not espresso, but it's great. If you're looking for a single cup of coffee without the 10 min waiting for a coffee pot, if you plan on making/drinking multiple cups a day...maybe invest in a moccamaster or something of that degree if you want the same level of quality that you can pretty easily pull from an aeropress. Happy Brewing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t filter coffee grinds. The filter paper gets crumpled when wet and the grounds get into coffee. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimee K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of using this it broke me of my $5 a day Starbucks latte habit. Makes really great coffee and expresso, easy to use once you practice for a week or so to get the coffee exactly how you like it. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had an Aeropress over 10 years! Ditched the plug in and never looked back. Have bought two more since for family and friends. We even have one in the camper. Makes amazingly smooth coffee to, being a press. We get compliments from visitors every time!
customer_reviews.author: Canoegirl

customer_reviews.title: This is the only way to make coffee - especially on the go
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST WAY WE HAVE EVER MADE COFFEE. Hands-down. Great on the go, great at home... we keep one in our car, one with our camping stuff, and one in the house. Have gotten many as gifts. The only thing I wish I got was the one that comes in a kit with cups and a travel case. We prefer this over keurig, french press, drip, perc, instant, and cuban-style. Very easy to put together, use, and clean. Save money while you travel by keeping a hot thermos of water (refill when you can) and brew with the AeroPress when you stop. Couldn't be happier with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: A Couple of Als (Mr. & Mrs. Al Gordon)

customer_reviews.title: Quick and simple coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent coffee maker. I'm not a big coffee fan so I didn't want to buy a full coffee maker that would take up counter space. This thing is light weight and I could take it anywhere with me if needed. I don't follow the instructions properly by grinding up the coffee or measuring it, but my coffee still has a nice taste. This thing is quick, and super easy to clean. Also doesn't waste any energy, so that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: S A

customer_reviews.title: Great!  My fav way to make home coffee for last 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little $30 coffee maker!!! I've had one for 2 years, bring it with me when traveling, ditched my French press and even my single-cup brewer... I just re-ordered bc I dropped it, and part of the plastic lip broke - necessitating a new one. Over time and with daily use, the inside does become slightly mottled or has a cracked appearance, my Mom's did the same thing only worse, but it doesn't really affect the performance. At only $30, even a replacement every 2-3 years isn't bad!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sea Kahrs

customer_reviews.title: Simplest, easiest and cleanest way of making coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Now, this is truly a great coffee pressor....you never get not one ground in your coffee and, it's easy to clean which is a plus I like! I have used many coffee devices, but this one is the "one". My sister had one and decided to buy one after seeing it in action!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Chase

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: This is great -- easy to use and much less mess than a French Press. There are lots of recipes online for different methods of coffee making using this.
customer_reviews.author: Free-range historian

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This is the smoothest cup of coffee ever!! I'm beginning to see a bit of leaking around the seal when the coffee is pressed, but not every time. Probably user error. I have stopped using my Breville YouBrew for everyday usage and we use the AeroPress every single day. It's easy to take along if you travel, too, and spares you from resorting to expensive and unsatisfactory hotel or coffee shop coffee. We grind our own beans and prefer a Ruta Maya or Mayorga Cuban coffee.
customer_reviews.author: VFL

product_meta.title: AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker and 350 Additional Filters - Quickly Makes Delicious Coffee Without Bitterness - 1 to 3 Cups Per Press
product_meta.description: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity. Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity created by the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds. Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks. Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable, making it also ideal for traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more! Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 700 microfilters and a filter holder. No Phthalates or BPA. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d
feature_bullets: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity.

Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity created by the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds.
Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks.
Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable, making it also ideal for traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more!
Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 700 microfilters and a filter holder. Phthalate free and BPA free. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d
